BasicIO

Class ReportPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • BasicIO.ReportPrinter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.print.Printable

    public class ReportPrinter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.print.Printable
    This class allows for text output to a printer in a report style.

    Titles
    A report may have a title. The title will appear centered at the top of the first page and every page created with the newPage method. A title can be multiple lines by passing a var args of Strings to the setTitle method.

    Fields
    Lines of the report are separated into fields. This produces a columnar organization when mutliple lines are written. Fields are displayed in the order of their creation. When adding a field there are the following optional parameters.

    name - the name of the field. Used for skipping to a specific field to perform a write operation. If a name is not specified then the field cannot be written to by specifying a name and can only be written to by sequence of writes.
    label - a label for the field. The labels are centered on the column for the field and printed on each page following the titles.
    format - the default format for data written to the field. If a format is not specified, then the data will not be formatted unless a format object is provided when writing data. If a format object is provided when adding a field and when writing data, then the format passed in the write method will be used.
    width - the size of the field. The size is the number of characters which may fit into the field. If a size is not specified, then the size is the length of the label. If neither a label nor a size is specified then the default size is 12 characters wide.

    Writing to a field:
    Write operations are performed from left to right, line by line. If a series of writes are performed without specifying a name for the field, the fields will be written to in the sequence of their creation. After the last field is written to, the next write will be performed on the first field created, on a new line. If a name is specified, spaces will be written to each field, until the field with the specified name is reached at which point the data will be written to the field. If the name of the field comes before the current field then the write will happen on a new line. Numbers are right justified and text is left justified.
    Version:
    1.0 July 2008, 2.0 (09/05/04), 3.0 (09/06/30), 4.0 (14/06/13)
    Author:
    Andrew Cheesman, David Hughes, David Hughes, David Hughes

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String... lines)
        Set the title on the report by passing a var args of strings to this method. Each string will be a seperate line of the title, and the title will show up on the first page of the report and every page created with the newPage() method.
        Parameters:
        lines - a var args of Strings, each String becomes a line in the title.

      • addField

        public void addField(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String label,
                     java.text.Format fmt,
                     int width)
        Adds a field to the report with specified name, label, default format and field width. Write operations are peformed on the fields which creates columns of data.
        All of the parameters are optional.(see "Fields" above)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the field. The field can be accessed for write operations by providing the name. For details of behaviour of writing by specifying a name and without a name see "Writing to a field" above.
        label - The label of the field column to be displayed on the report. The label is centered over the field.
        fmt - A default format for writing to the field.
        width - The width of the field.

      • writeBoolean

        public void writeBoolean(java.lang.String name,
                         boolean b,
                         java.text.Format fmt)
        Writes the boolean value to the field with the specified name and left justifying the output. If the field with the specified name is not the next field, then blank data will be written to each field until the specified field is next.
        If a name is not specified the data is written to the next field. All parameters except the boolean are optional (see Fields above)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the field.
        b - the value to write
        fmt - a format object to format the data with.

      • writeBoolean

                         boolean b)
        See Also:
        ( String name, boolean b, Format fmt )

      • print

        public int print(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 java.awt.print.PageFormat pf,
                 int page)
          throws java.awt.print.PrinterException
        This method is used by Java for printing.
        This method is called by the system. It should not be called directly by the program.
        Specified by:
        print in interface java.awt.print.Printable
        Throws:
        java.awt.print.PrinterException
